title: Is it possible to work on the Sound Transit?
text:
Maybe it's just pandemic fever, but I'm considering moving to Olympia and commuting to Seattle 2 - 3 times per week (and WFH the other 2 - 3 days).  I can just get \_so\_ much more house there and be surrounded by forrest, live in a cul de sac, etc.  I figured my commute would be:  
\- Drive from Olympia to Lakewood  
\- Take the Lakewood - Seattle Sounder (and \_hopefully\_ get to work on the train)  
\- Leave work \~1hr early and work on train for ride back  
\- Drive from Lakewood to home  


Is this a feasible plan?  Is even 3x a week too much?  I'd like to be able to continue to stay available for more job prospects (I'm a Cloud Infra Eng (aka DevOps-y stuff) in the future with the assumption that a new job would require me to be in the office 3x a week still.

Anyone else doing this already?  


Thanks in advance!
